column4: any idea why ubuntu 9.10 is hanging with a blank screen during the installer when I try to re-install it on my desktop?
most work fine
have you checked the respective gnove versions? It seems the gdm has trobles handeling a update.
what do you mean?
I am installing fresh from the install CD
I did a manual gnome update a while back and I got a blank screen at startup.
what is odd is that I am running 9.10 now and it works fine, but when I try to install it from the cd I can't.
is the CD the same ubuntu version?
yes
but I got 9.10 before by upgrading from 9.04
and the disk version is updated from the CD??
right.. Well the CD shoudn't see the disk version.
it doesn't, that's not the issue
it just hangs when I try to install
that leaves a bad disk. Have you checked the CD for bad sectors?
I did the consistency check and it's OK. but to be sure, I re-downloaded the ISO and burned the disk again. same issue
ok, so basically 9.10 is the problem. And a update overts the problem. How about the graphics driver on the disk version?
nvidia's proprietary one is what I use on the version I have installed
well obviously the disk version doesn't use that. What happens when you trie to run GDM on disk with the standatd driver? (To log in if it fails use the text option in the grub loader
I haven't tried that. I could try installing in the safe graphics mode and it might work
worth a try..
how do I fix it once installed if it hangs every time at boot?
that is, get the proprietary driver installed
